author: gcolvin
content: I just wonder for how long we can keep creating new chat clients and a quadratically expanding number of lossy bridges between them before we give up and go back to IRC.  The 21st century has been a huge technological disappointment so far, <@!301186049323958275>

author: sky.cactus
content: I personally like Discord's feature set far more than IRC or Gitter.

author: sky.cactus
content: Reactions specifically I find hugely valuable as it allows me to give feedback on statements without having to mark a channel as unread for everyone.

author: sky.cactus
content: Standardized rendering of inline quotes and code blocks is also a big win.

author: sky.cactus
content: IRC is fine if *all* you want is pure text with no features (no voice, no video, no reactions, no reliable rendering system for code and markdown, etc.  I just think all of those features add up enough to make switching to something like Discord worth it.

author: sky.cactus
content: Oh, also message editing is a godsend.
